content.description: Start matched on blocky undercling on left side of roof. Climb straight up through jugs to crux slopey top out.
content.location: From the leftmost parking spot at Rainbow Mountain, walk straight downhill towards a small cluster of boulders. The roof is located behind the giant fallen tree.

content.description: Start same as Yonder-cling but keep traversing on jugs along lip of roof and finish same as Rainbow Ride.
content.location: From the leftmost parking spot at Rainbow Mountain, walk straight downhill towards a small cluster of boulders. The roof is located behind the giant fallen tree.

content.description: Wall behind playground. Follow the white section of rock to sketchy top out
content.protection: Pad maybe two and a spotter
content.location: Behind playground

content.description: Start matched in the undercling, reach up to the left jug then palm your right hand go get your feet up, then reach the pinch and top out right above it. The edge of the crack is off.
content.location: If you come from the water tower trail, it is on the far back left side of the boulder feild.

content.description:
About 75% along the rail, the rock gets a little moist and slopey.

 V4 problem if eliminate base boulder (Stick to rail).
content.location: The start is next to White Russian on the other side of the boulder. Sit start on the slopers and move right along the rail to the top out.

content.description: Start matched on angled rail. Work through funky moves to the right and top out. A great warm up problem!
content.location: Walk down trail above balance rock.  Problem is located on a wall next to a big thorny patch of blackberry bushes.  Look for lone pinch above sloping ledge.

content.description: A fun but chaotic climb in a cave, start matched on the far back rail, then use anything but the ground to get out of the cave, then grab those jugs on the outside and top out to the left. The down climb will slide you right back to where you stared, if you want a dumb challenge do a 3 lap race with your buddys.
content.location: Same cave as “Covid Cave 19”. Follow the trail from the parking lot, stay to the right and go to the lower section, keep walking and you will see a cave with some graffiti, that’s the spot.

content.description: Start on the chalked hold, make the top out exciting as you like, you can do this easier, but going straight up and left seemed fun!
Start on the lip of the slab. Climb the lip up and to the end then pull up and mantle to the top. We hooked three pads together to protect the slab below and one at the bottom if you slid down.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter to move the pads around
content.location: Can’t miss it. Probably the fittest climb down the hill.

content.description: Start on two left side pulls and dyno to a nice jug.  top out to the right of the landing jug using just the upper rock for feet, not the lower one.
Match on the angled rail, right hand out, then left to a fun pinch and move straight up, easy holds all the way, top out high foot mantle between the two top rocks.
content.location: To your left on the rainbow loop trail, one of the first big rocks you see.

content.description:
obvious wide crack. great to practice some off width technique. good arm bars and chicken wings. some hand stacks and hand fist stacks towards the top. easy top out. 

 if anyone has info on this route (FA,name, etc) let me know. gave it a name so I don't start a trend of Unknown(Vgrade)
content.location: Past Amun's Route on the back side of the boulders where Wild Trail and Rainbow Mountain Loop Trail meet

content.description: Start at back of roof on jugs. Make moves to slopers at lip (heel-toe cams help) then reach to higher jugs and top out.
content.location: From the leftmost parking spot at Rainbow Mountain, walk straight downhill towards a small cluster of boulders. The roof is located behind the giant fallen tree.

content.description: Sit start with a pocket and an under-cling and move around the face of the boulder to an easy top-out.  I’m pretty sure someone has climbed this but I didn’t see it listed. It’s a fun climb!
content.location: Follow Jake’s Trail down from the playground. The boulder is off to the side of a trail intersection.

content.description:
Same sit start as Crap Crimp. But instead of moving right using arete features, climb using only face holds directly above starting holds.

 Sit start on right pinch and left crimp (all feet are on). Left to shallow jug and right to good hueco. From there, fire up to the worse of the two pinches with left and find a way to get your right hand to the other pinch in front of you. Rock to the rail, and top out (all arete features off).
content.location: Same rock as off-width, Crap Crimp, and A.S.S on left trail coming from parking lot. Boulder is on the right side of the trail.

content.description: Start right hand on the side-pull pocket and left hand on the slope-pinch thing. ledge to the right and huge side rail to the left is off (see photo). Right hand goes to the compression then left to the top jug. Top out is sketch, but not bad. You can always start further left and traverse if you're bored.
content.protection: 1 or 2 Bouldering pads; maybe a spotter
content.location: Mountain Loop Trail. Same area as South Paw. On the same rock as Happiness Is Easy (left of it).

content.description: Start on the pocket on the arete right of “Just Like That”, throw a heel up. That’s the start. This is an eliminate problem.. make it fun. Traverse into the dihedral using toe and heel hooks. Ascend the dihedral. Do not use the rails below. Feet aren’t allowed lower than the hand traverse ledge.
content.location: To the right of just like that.

content.description: Start with right hand on good hold and left on crimp(the top of the bottom rocks are off for feet, use the faces of these rocks as your feet for the true v4). move up to nice crimp rail. Move up right to big pocket, then use jugs to traverse out right. Finally, big move up to small jug, bump to the okay hold right above it, move up to the top of the taller rock, and top out onto the smaller rock. This is a sketchy top out, be mindful and have good pads and spotters.
content.location: Big roof past the artist and damp it. Look for the chalk drawing of an ogre which is to the right of the start (if its there).

content.description: Start matched on an excellent crimp rail and with a high right foot in a good slot (bottom rock below crack is off, see photos for a better description). Launch up to a good but gritty black jug. Then move into two decent crimps in black seam, and then right and up throught jugs to the top. (huge shelf in the middle right of the route is off, but all other shelf are on at the top. See photo for better detail). Topout is dirty and kinda sketchy so go scope/clean it before sending.
content.location: Directly right of Ogre It, on the other side of the chalk ogre.

content.description: Start matched on the bottom rail, and move up to the top out directly above!
content.location: From the water tower walk down the path a little ways and it will be right in front of you

content.description: Same start as White Russian, but traverse along the lip with heel and toe hooks until the end and mantle over. Fun.
content.location: Same start as White Russian

content.description: Left paw on the sloping side pull pinch, right paw on the moon crimp. Sit start and pull the roof straight up,don’t cheat and grab the crimps/jugs to the left or some far right. Make it fun.
content.location: Down the trail that the just like that and others are in. Can’t remember if this was after or before.

content.description:
Start under the roof with your feet off the lower rock, fully on the roof. Move to the shelf and then out right to the roof. Heel hook and mantle. 

  I assume someone has done this before so happy to correct the name etc just trying to contribute to the area.
content.location: Along the cliff band towards the end of coming from the water tower. The boulder is on the right.

content.description: follow the mossy wall up the pockets. trend left at the upper horizontal crack to sketchy top out.
content.protection: pad. probably more and a spotter if you plan on topping out. a fall from the top move isn't fun
content.location: behind the play ground. start 10 ft right of Unknown V2

content.description: Start on big sloper rail, establish feet, and launch backwards and right to a big and obvious slopey jug. From there search around for jugs for an easy top out. A true one move wonder, the grade depends on your height. The landing zone is a bit sketchy so use multiple pads
content.location: on the same rock as happiness is easy, on the side facing south paw

content.description: Start under a roof. Work through downward facing huecos to reach a crimp on the face. A solid foot on the rightside hueco will ensure a controlled finish, but some choose to campus.
content.location: From the trailhead that starts at the watertower, continue along the cliff for a couple hundred feet past several boulders until you reach a roof on the left side of the trail. Just Like That starts underneath the far right side of the roof.

content.description: Start matched on the bottom jug, big move to get your right hand to a decent jug, move left hand up to get your fingers into the above crack, then grab the final jug to top out.
content.location: At the tip of the fumble step boulder, if you follow the main path there will be a place to walk down on the right (past the benches) and it is right there.

climbs.name: I’m not getting in that cave

content.description: Start matched on the bottom rail with a right foot under the cave and left near the outside or hooking the rail. Jump your right hand to the jug on the right and left to the side-pull, bump your right hand then get your left hand to that far left jug to top out.
content.location: Same area as south paw. In the center of the main boulder field.

content.description: Start on prominent jug feature. Climb through jugs finishing on left of prow. Don't miss good hold far back for top out.
content.location: Prow feature located behind Rainbow Ride boulder.

climbs.name: I think I’ll just stay here and drink

content.description: Start is low and matched on the circled jug. Top out starlight above don’t cheat. This is also by the others on the same trail as mama tried.
Start matched on the under-cling. Go matched to the circled side-pull. Reach to the jug on the right and top out. Try to restrict yourself on certain footholds for a bit of a challenge.
content.location: Same rock and area as A.S.S. and directly to the right of Crap Crimp.

content.description:
Same sit start as "not getting in that cave" problem, but instead of climbing arete, climb using only face features. *Traversing right of face is not part of the problem*

 Sit start matched underneath rail with good feet. Pop up to left sidepull, lock off, and go for big reach to sandy crimp with the right. Funky moves to adjust feet before bumping to slopey edge. Bring left hand up to lip and top out.
content.location:
In the middle intersection between trails leading directly from the parking lot (next to South Paw).

 Somewhat sketchy landing since you can't really fit a normal sized pad between you and the ground at the start.

content.description: Same start as Okie from Muskogee, but this is not an eliminate. Use your best feet traveling the line to the dihedral. Good warm up.
content.location: To the right of just like that

content.description: Follow a thin crack line up a steep slab. A few fingerjams lead up to the top.
content.protection: One fixed bolt at the top. Pad and spotter possible, but dangerous since the landing goes downhill.
content.location: Down the right trail by the water tower. Close to the parking lot.

content.description:
Poor rock quality, “crumby canyon wall and I’m taking you with me”-kuzco..

 I saw chalk on this sit start eliminate. You pull a couple moves on small crimps and if you keep you feet high enough it keeps it a little harder. Could be veasy. Idk kinda felt like it would fall on me.
content.location: Same side as the Merle haggard routes.

content.description: Start same as Iron Fist on prominent jug. After opening moves, break right and finish on crux top out above scary ledge.
content.location: Prow behind Rainbow Ride boulder.

content.description: start is the same as "the artist" bump left to the second move on artist, then a far right reach to the corner, then pull up to a sloper on the top, match, and top out
content.location: next to the artist, right of the cliffs past the water tower trailhead

content.description: Start is a very bad left hand nub crimp and a sloping pinch for the right paw
content.location: On the same rock as the off width but20 ft before you get to it on main trail

content.description: Start out in a compression start between a small crimp on your right and a crimpy sidepull with your left, both have tick marks. Use any feet except the lower rock on the right. Get up the two upper rails and traverse right, and then a huge dynamic move to a backwards jug above your head. Then top out with all the jugs
content.location: pass south paw and look for a sharp 90 degree overhang and go down to the trail it is on. Follow this trail until you see the cave.

content.description: Start matched on a side-pull jug, reach a left hand to a crimp right on the bottom of the overhang, then hop your right hand to a jug on the right, then top out(traversing left to the horn on top provides a good top out)
content.location: Follow the trail from the water tower, and it will be on your left, there is a large rock across from this climb as well.

content.description: A reachy first move to a mantle at the finish.
content.location: from the watertower trailhead, continue until you reach the top of the cliffs. Walk right past a bench about 50 feet until it is possible to walk down to the base of the cliffs. The Artist is the obvious first route, immediately after the walkdown from the top of the cliffs.

content.description: Start low. Heel hook and go up and right to a crimp.
content.location: To the right of the roof with Just Like This.

content.description: i saw chalk on the wall and started from a weird low hold sit start. The route was very fun! Was moist up top so this may be easier when dry.
content.location: The same rock as the off widthmaybe like 10 feet to the right

content.description: Easy bouldering with an unbeatable approach. Great for a quick climb after work.
